roleset.name: attach (as with a hook)
roleset.note: HOOK-V NOTES: Member of Vncls 22.4. (from hook.01-v)

role.descr: thing now attached, first or all things hooked
hook, thing arg1 is attached to

example.name: metaphorical hook
example.text: [P& G and others]-1 also have tried repeatedly *trace*-1 to hook consumers on detergent and fabric softener combinations in pouches, but they haven't sold well, despite the convenience.
example.arg: on detergent and fabric softener combinations in pouches

example.name: with attribute
example.text: IBM will face an uphill climb against Digital, given Digital-1's reputation for *trace*-1 being better than IBM at *trace*-1 hooking together different manufacturers' computers.

roleset.name: (cause to) exist in a hook shape
roleset.note: HOOK-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls coil-9.6-1. (from hook.03-v)

example.name: arg1 as subject
example.text: And most of the truly big scams in Orange County seem to originate in Newport Beach or one of the other well-heeled communities that surround this sliver-like city that *trace* hooks around a point of land on the California coast south of Los Angeles.
example.arg: that -> one of the other well-heeled communities

example.name: all args
example.text: He hooked his fingers around the steering wheel.

roleset.name: attach, phrasal variant
roleset.note: HOOK_UP-V NOTES: See VN class tape-22.4, but verb particle construction is not in class. (from hook.02-v)

example.name: pseudopassive?
example.text: In the U.S., one-fifth of the office PCs are hooked up to some sort of network.

example.name: agentive
example.text: John hooked up his computer to the network.
